message.welcome: Welcome to the Flutter Translate example app!

presentation.welcome: Welcome to the Companions of the Tour de France!
presentation.discover: Explore the history and tradition of the Companions.

questions.text: I am Noémie, I am 24 years old. I started discovering the world of construction by learning the trade of cabinetmaking after obtaining my general baccalaureate. I committed to the Tour de France after completing a CAP in cabinetmaking.
Question 1: But what is the Tour de France?
Correct answer! The Tour de France is a journey where the future companion changes cities every year.

Question 2 : The first city to welcome me was Annecy. I am with about thirty other young people, various trades are represented: carpenter, joiner, cabinetmaker, plumber, baker and the best: joiner! Among these photos, which model was made by a joiner?
Correct answer! The joiner's mission? Creating and repairing wooden furniture, whether antique or modern!
Question 3: You will find on the wall this famous postcard. What do I remember from this first year? (Two correct answers)
Correct answer! The companions are one big family!
Question 4: Plumbers also make models. What is the main material of this model? Hint, the Limoges station is covered with it! (Photo)
Correct answer! Do you know that copper changes color when oxidized? That's why the station roof is green!
Question 5: You can find several works created by Building Painters. One of them represents the emblem of the city of Limoges. Can you recognize it?
Correct answer! This emblem represents the flames of the ovens necessary for the production of porcelain and enamels. Limoges is the capital of the fire arts!
Question 6: In your opinion, what is the purpose of this last one?
Correct answer! Doing the Tour de France is a marathon towards excellence. The young itinerants constantly seek to improve themselves. This is illustrated by the study works.
Question 7: What does this masterpiece made by an itinerant Mason represent? (photo)
Correct answer! The flying buttress serves to support the walls from the outside. You can observe them a stone's throw from the museum while walking in the park and contemplating the cathedral.
Question 8: I am so fond of this new city that I forget to name it! I prefer to tell about my first lessons there. What is their particularity?
choiceAnswers: They are in the evening and on weekends
correctAnswers: They are in the evening and on weekends

questions.text: Correct answer! The itinerants of the Tour de France are professionals who work during the day like any employees. Therefore, improvement classes take place during their rest: in the evenings and on weekends.
Question 9: Now here is this model, was it made by a single itinerant?
Correct answer! This model has the particularity of having been made by several people. Nowadays, models are mostly made individually.
Question 10: In front of you is a work crafted by an itinerant joiner, who do you think it was intended for?
Correct answer! Models must be presented and validated by companions of the same trade in order to validate the skills of the young itinerant.
Question 11: What is this event called?
Correct answer! The patron saint festivals are an opportunity for companions and itinerants to meet once a year. These festivals are national and specific to each trade society.
Question 12: The mother of the Carpenters, Cabinetmakers, and Locksmiths Companions is the same person, as they are one and the same society! What is the current mother's name of Limoges?
Correct answer! You can meet the mother of the Limoges Companions every day at the restaurant La Table des Compagnons!
Question 13: I am a young companion joiner, try to guess which one belongs to me.
Correct answer! Three colors exist according to the grade. For joiners: .
Question 14: Among these canes, can you find the one of a blacksmith?
Correct answer! The cane was once the support object of the Tour de France, as it was done... ON FOOT!
Question 15: Upon arrival, I am lucky to have as a boss, a companion joiner. Today joiners are rare! For his reception, he made a table in 2003, what is its particularity?
Correct answer! Reception masterpieces - to become a companion - have the particularity of being chosen by their maker. Each masterpiece represents the personality of its creator!

Question 16: In 2004, a carpenter was received as a companion. We are lucky to have before our eyes the two major stages: the full-scale drawing - a pattern - and the model. How many colors are there on this pattern?
Correct answer! Note that originally, no colors existed! They were added to help visitors understand the layout.
Question 17: In this postcard, I write many details about the course of this past year. What are they?
choiceAnswers: The attribution of my companion name
The reception during a patron saint festival
correctAnswers: The attribution of my companion name
The reception during a patron saint festival

questions.text: Correct answer! Yes, all these proposals are correct! And many more would be needed to describe this unique experience!
Question 18: The painter made a dedication to two cities dear to him: the first city of his Tour and his last one. Can you recognize them?
Correct answer! To represent Limoges, he chose to paint the headquarters of the Limoges Companions surmounted by the Saint-Etienne cathedral. This same view you can observe when leaving the museum!
Question 19: I stay in Limoges for another year. I am 'the roller', I accompany the youngest. During this period, I discover the Limoges Companions Museum! How many masterpiece hats are there?
Correct answer! Hat off to the artist! There is a specific hat for the rollers: it is the top hat! (Photo)
Question 20: Here is an original and imposing masterpiece: a wine cellar inspired by picnic baskets. What are the wood species used?
Correct answer! Congratulations! The quiz is over! You've been perfect! Like any worthy companion, one last question follows to give you your own budding companion name!
